newsitem.title: FRANCE: EU grain export commitments reach 26.56 mln tns.
newsitem.headline: EU grain export commitments reach 26.56 mln tns.

text.p: European Union grain export commitments up to May 13 rose 62.4 percent over last year, official figures showed on Friday.

Figures supplied by member country officials showed grain earmarked for export between July 1, 1996 and May 13, 1997 totalled 26.56 million tonnes against 16.356 million during the same period last year.
Exports of commercial soft wheat grain reached 9.786 million tonnes against 5.653 million a year earlier. Soft wheat flour exports jumped to 5.766 million tonnes from 3.744 million.
Barley exports reached 6.069 million tonnes against 1.559 million tonnes.
On Thursday the European Union granted the export of 89,200 tonnes of barley, 8,500 tonnes of oats, and 46,379 tonnes of rye.
The EU has closed the weekly tender for wheat exports and imposed a tax of 15 Ecus per tonne on daily soft wheat exports and of 20 ecus per tonne on soft wheat flour exports.
The move is aimed at keeping domestic prices and supplies under control in the face of volatile prices.
